intro: Lobivia backebergii var. zecheri, commonly known as the Zecher's lobivia, is a compact, low-growing succulent native to South Africa. It features dense clusters of blue-green, fleshy leaves that are typically covered in a fine, white powdery coating. The plant produces tall, branched stems with tubular, violet-pink flowers during the warmer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and slow growth, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
